H0.text: Protons are the basic units of matter that have the same properties as an element.

H1.text: Electrons are the basic units of matter that have the same properties as an element.

H2.text: Atoms are the basic units of matter that have the same properties as an element.

H3.text: Neutrons are the basic units of matter that have the same properties as an element.

A4.text: Atoms are the basic particles of the chemical elements and the fundamental building blocks of matter.

A5.text: By definition, any two atoms with an identical number of protons in their nuclei belong to the same chemical element.

A6.text: The nuclear charge is the physical basis for the atomic number.

A7.text: The standard model of an atom is of a dense nucleus of charged protons and electrically-neutral neutrons, surrounded by an electrically-bound cloud of low mass, negatively charged electrons.
